intro: Chamaesyce fendleri var. triligulata, commonly known as the three-lobed sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique floral structures called cyathia. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually lobed, with the variety triligulata distinguished by its three prominent lobes. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts.
